captions.text:
Singapore is one of the busiest countries
in South East Asia.

It may look small on the map, but do not
underestimate this country
because everything is concentrated here.
And I have only 24 hours,

so I've compiled a list of places to see,
items to look at.

And let me bring you on my journey
to enjoy uniquely Singapore.

Getting around Singapore is very convenient
using the MRT or LRT.

The standard ticket can be used
for six times, so keep it for a while.

It is a must to taste chilli crabs
or else do not leave Singapore.

The plan is to actually have dinner today
at Jumbo Restaurant,
which was recommended by a friend.

It is said that they have the best
chilli crab in Singapore.

But unfortunately it is a Saturday
and it is fully booked.

It was just impossible to get a place
at this restaurant.

So what I did instead was to buy the
paste from the restaurant.

Here I have the chilli crab paste
and this is their black pepper paste.

Hopefully I can cook something just as
delicious as the restaurant here.

On the other hand I made a reservation
at Red House to try their chilli crabs.
So hopefully it is just as good.

Red House offers a great variety
of Chinese dishes.

The restaurant, which is close
to Clarke Quay, is large
and the service was great.

The waitress took time to answer
all my questions.

Finally, I settled for the chilli crab
which was so juicy.

And just in case I got messy while eating,
I had to use a bip.

I also had Kangkung belacan and steam fish
which were equally amazing.

After that, I took a stroll at Clarke Quay
where all the clubs and bars are located.

As it was a Saturday night, the whole
place was crowded.

And I was told that it goes on till 4
in the morning.

Along the way I discovered a stall selling
ice cream sandwich.
Priced only at 1 SGD you must try this.

Another fruit that I enjoy a lot is
jack fruit, which is this fruit over here.

It's slightly leathery, it's thick
but it's also sweet.
It's delicious.

Best eaten when it's fried but I like
it raw or fresh like this.
It's really, really yummy.

I haven't had all these fruits for
about two years, and finally

Situated in the middle of Little India,
this is one place you should go
I'm standing right above The Shoppes mall

which is opposite the ever-magnificent
Marina Bay Sands hotel.

And I just realized that there is a bridge
connecting these two buildings together.
And you know what?
Who plays Michael Bublé at the lift?

It's just so romantic. The whole city is
so beautiful, so vibrant.
I love this city. I have nothing else to say.
I love Singapore!

Also, do not forget to visit
the Supertree Grove.

This is not like any garden
I've ever seen before.
It looks really futuristic.

You can also enjoy the view from the top
as you walk along the bridge.

Being in a tropical country like Singapore
does not mean it is always sunny and nice.

I wanted to go to Chinatown.
Unfortunately it started raining.
So I have no choice but to just stay indoors

and then I found this coffee store
called Trung Nguyen.

It serves Vietnamese coffee. It's actually
known to be the Starbucks of Vietnam.

I have a cup here. The actual coffee is
only half a cup.

And this Vietnamese coffee has different levels,
from level one to level five.

I took level three because I normally
drink Latte Macchiato.

It's not that strong. European coffee would
be at the same level with level four.

She added Vietnamese condensed milk
to the coffee.

It's very delicious, very fragrant.
It has a bit of a caramel taste.
So something like coffee with caramel.
If you have nothing else to do,

or when it is raining you can always
stop by to try the coffee.
It's a good decision to have coffee here.
A food court is what I miss in Germany
but this I found in Bugis Junction.

I made a stop at Old Chang Kee
for a curry puff

before continuing my journey
to more food.
That was all the time I had for Singapore.

I hope to return again, and next time,
I will surely stay for more than 24 hours.
My next holiday spot is Seoul, Korea.

So subscribe and give a thumbs up
if you want to watch more.
I see you in the next video. Bye!

title: Moments in Singapore: 24 Hours Travel Guide
